text: [Music]
HIDA sistema welcome back to another
lesson on pronouncing the alphabet X
correctly now a lot of English learners
have a very similar problem and a very
common problem of using or pronouncing
the words with X correctly in fact
amongst pretty much all the alphabets in
the English language pronouncing X
becomes a bit of a challenge I'll tell
you why because there are several ways
of pronouncing this one alphabet but I'm
gonna make it very simple for you I'm
gonna show you different ways of how to
say this word say this alphabet
depending on which word you are going to
use it with so stay tuned and pay
attention to when you are going to use
the alphabet X in what ways while
pronouncing it now the most common way
of pronouncing X is with is with the
Chris sound okay so it's a kiss
cus sound okay it's not exactly a curse
on but it's a kiss sound but there are
four things you need to remember in
order to draw out the kiss sound when
you are using the alphabet X so there
are four conditions to use the kiss
sound you can use either of these
conditions in order to get this sound in
a word the first condition is that the X
will be followed by a consonant sound
okay so the X will be followed by a
a consonant sound so all other sounds
apart from a e i o u R consonant sounds
let's have a look at the word next the X
is followed by the T which is a
consonant and a consonant sound so you
will say next the X would have a next
because the X is followed by the
consonant sound okay
the second thing you need to remember in
order to have the X giving you the kiss
sound is when X is used at the end of a
word so let's look at a word like
relaxed the X is at the end of the word
and therefore the X gives me the kiss
sound okay let's do this once again the
first thing you have to remember is that
the X for it to give you a kiss sound
should be followed by the consonant
sound in this case we have an example
next because the T is a consonant the
second condition is that the X has to be
at the end of the word to give you the
kiss sound like the relax okay the third
condition or the third way that you can
draw out the kiss sound when using the
word or the alphabet X is when you have
X followed by the vowel sound however in
this case the syllable after X is not
the stronger one
so the syllable after X is the weaker
one okay so
for example we have taxi the X is
followed by the vowel sound because I or
the e sound is a vowel sound however you
are using the kiss sound because the
syllable after the X is the weaker one
so before the X you have tau which is a
stronger syllable but after the X you
have a E which is a smaller syllable so
you use the X to be a kiss sound when
the X is followed by a vowel sound
however the syllable after that X has to
be the weaker one like taxi the kiss
sound and the fourth condition which I
haven't mentioned on the board is when
you are using a prefix so for example
you have words like ex-wife or Exim ploy
e prefix always is followed by a hyphen
so when you use prefixes like my
ex-boyfriend or your ex-wife or I'm an
ex employee that's when you will again
use the ex with the kiss sound okay so I
hope you've got this part clear and very
simple to understand for you but now
because I said that X can be used in
several ways the ex has another sound it
does make in some words which is the
goose sound so this was the kiss sound
and this is the goose sound okay let's
see how and which words are those which
give you the goose sound again there are
two conditions the first condition is
that the x2 give you the kiss sound has
to be followed by a vowel sound
with no underlying conditions okay so X
followed by the vowel sound will give
you the kiss sound in a word so you have
a executive you don't say an X executive
you say an executive a lot of English
learners say executive which is wrong
it's AG good executive okay so we have
the X followed by the vowel sound which
is the S sound so therefore you say
executive okay it's an executive so the
other instance when X will give you the
goose sound is when you have X followed
by a stronger syllable for example you
have the word X in this world the
alphabet X in this word which is
followed by the stronger syllable that's
why you will say example the good sound
eggs egg sample because am po is the
stronger syllable the serval which is
stressed as opposed to a before the X
which is the weaker one so when you have
the X which is followed by the stronger
syllable or if you have the X which is
followed by a vowel sound that's when
you will always get the good sound so
you have words like executive and
example okay that's how you will use the
good sound in an X but what about
another way of using the same alphabet
well this is very common in fact it's
not very common because these words are
very are not used so much but the X can
also give you a Z sound but the only
condition for it to give you a Z sound
is if the X is used in has the first
word
so whenever X is the first word in your
is the first alphabet in your word
that's when you get the Z sound so you
have a word like Xerox X is at the
beginning of the word so it has a Z
sound it won't have a kiss sort or a
good sound because it's in the beginning
so it's got a Xerox a word like this
which is an name of a person really its
Xavier the Z sound you can't have a kiss
or a good sound because these the X is
coming as the first alphabet in this
word okay and now an X also creates two
other special sounds I call it special
because there are very very few words in
the English language which make the
sound okay it is the cush and the good
ok the cush and the good but these
sounds come in an X only if the X is
followed with a u so words like sexual
the pish it's not a sexual it's not a
sexual or as says well it's a sex the
Krish sound because the X in this word
is followed by a u so it gives you a
special sound which says sexual the
Krish sound also if the X in some cases
is followed by the you can also give you
the goosh sound for example the word
luxury it's not a luxury so it's not the
cush sound it's the good sound in luxury
ok so these are the different ways that
you will pronounce the letter X
I'm sure if you keep practicing and if
